events.message: Applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses. All initial information was complete and clear.
Loan application was categorised as a personal loan based on the applicant's request for medical treatment financing.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to handle the personal loan case for medical needs, initiating direct communication with the applicant.
Initial review of application data confirmed medical bills and income verification documents are required to proceed further.
Requested medical invoices, proof of income, and identification documents from the applicant to verify loan eligibility.
Applicant promptly submitted medical bills, pay slips, and a government-issued ID as requested for further evaluation.
Completed credit check indicating the applicant has a good score with a history of timely repayments.
Risk assessment finalized showing moderate risk due to recent increase in medical expenses but stable income sources.
A personal loan offer was presented to the applicant outlining interest rates, repayment schedule, and loan term details.
Applicant responded positively to the loan offer, requesting clarification about early repayment penalties.
Application escalated to senior loan manager due to applicant inquiries about special repayment terms.
Senior manager approved the loan with adjusted repayment flexibility as requested by the applicant.
Loan funds were successfully transferred to the applicantâ€™s account to cover medical treatment expenses.
Follow-up with applicant confirmed satisfaction with loan terms and repayment schedule after first installment.
Personal loan application case closed successfully after all procedural steps were completed and approved.
